title: Australia’s most expensive home revealed: One Sydney Harbour penthouse sells for over $140m
text:
An incredible nine-bedroom penthouse has been crowned Australia’s most expensive home, selling for more than $140 million.

The record price for the property in the One Sydney Harbour project in Barangaroo South tops the $100 million paid by Atlassian co-founder Mike Cannon-Brookes for Point Piper estate Fairwater in 2018.

RELATED: Atlassian co-founder snaps up Fairwater for ‘close to $100 million’

The residence, which is yet to be built, will consist of the premier penthouse and the accompanying sub-penthouse apartment, and spans the top three floors of the tallest of Lendlease’s three residential towers.

MORE: Sydney lawyer’s $60m masterstroke

Sydney’s newest $50m waterfront listing

The home will include more than 1600sqm of living space as well as a private rooftop pool, spa and gym, with the main bedroom set to be bigger than most family homes.

The buyer has been confirmed to be a local, who is planning to call One Sydney Harbour home.

On top of the most expensive residential property ever sold in Australia, the sale also breaks the $100,000 per sqm barrier, with the previous high set at $96,400 in 2017 by the sale of a 280sqm penthouse in the Opera Residences development.

Designed by Renzo Piano, One Sydney Harbour will consist of three towers and is the final piece of the residential, commercial, restaurant and retail precinct in Barangaroo South.

The towers will have views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House as well as out to the Blue Mountains.

Kylie Rampa, CEO property of Lendlease said the sale would have a huge impact on the property landscape.

“The sale of the penthouse at One Sydney Harbour is a paradigm shift for the Australian property market with an apartment claiming the title of Australia’s most valuable residential property for the first time, a title historically reserved for significant houses,” she said.

So far there has been more than $1 billion in sales and commitments achieved with huge interest from local buyers.
description: The Australian property record has been shattered with a local buyer paying more than $140 million for this luxury penthouse in the heart of Sydney.
